page.title: 01The area-a general view
page.content: The area of study lies to the north of the sea inlet of Balta Sound in Unst. It is largely composed of hill land used as rough grazing. The main community of Baltasound is scattered.There is RAF housing at Setter's Hill Estate and a small estate at Nikkavord Lea. A.Sandison &Son is an important local employer,based at the North Side pier.There are 2 hotels.P.Y.Mills garage operates the local bus service.Close to Unst's oldest house at Halligarth is the island's only wood.The Junior High School provides education up to the age of 16.Loch of Cliff is a popular recreation area. Proposed mining developments on Crussa Field have aroused considerable local controversy.
